headline: International Paper finalises European plant divestiture
summary: International Paper has completed the sale of five European plants to PALM Group, fulfilling regulatory commitments.

raw.headline: International Paper finalises European plant divestiture
raw.summary: International Paper has completed the sale of five European plants to PALM Group, fulfilling regulatory commitments.

headline: Packaging Corp to buy Greif's containerboard business for $1.8 billion
summary: Shares of Packaging Corp and Greif rose 3.5% each.  The all-cash deal helps Greif cut down its debt.  The deal also aligns with Greif's sustainability strategy called "Built to Last," the company said in a separate statement.

raw.headline: Packaging Corp to buy Greif's containerboard business for $1.8 billion
raw.summary: Shares of Packaging Corp and Greif rose 3.5% each.  The all-cash deal helps Greif cut down its debt.  The deal also aligns with Greif's sustainability strategy called "Built to Last," the company said in a separate statement.

headline: International Paper Completes Divestiture of Five European Corrugated Box Plants to Satisfy Regulatory Commitments from the Acquisition of DS Smith Plc
summary: International Paper (NYSE: IP; LSE: IPC), a global leader in sustainable packaging, today announced the completion of the divestiture of five European plants to PALM Group to satisfy regulatory commitments from its acquisition of DS Smith Plc. The sale includes (i) three plants in Normandy, France (namely, one box plant in Saint-Amand, one box plant in Mortagne, and one sheet plant in Cabourg); (ii) one box plant in Ovar, Portugal; and (iii) one box plant in Bilbao, Spain.
